title: Riot is trying skin themes
body:
They are looking for skin theme reactions of players and how much those skin themes are sold. Examples are Star Guardian and Project. They firstly released only one skin for each other. Project Yasuo and Star Guardian Lux. Then they realized potential of those skin themes and planned to continue on them.

It is obvious and not the reason of creating this thread though.

The thing I would want to say is, could we see a bunch of Cosmic Reaver skin in the same patch like how we had for Project and how we are going to have for Star Guardian? Because as I remember, Cosmic Reaver Kassadin had a pretty good reaction and this skin theme has potential that should never be wasted of.

Cosmic Reaver Xerath, Jhin, Aatrox please.

That's pretty close, Sometimes we get surprised by the response to skins- Project Yasuo and SG Lux are great examples where we didn't anticipate the positive reception they would get. It made us think "Oh wow people love this, okay let's invest in these alternate universes more." So nothings out of the realm of possibility! :)

I too am a big fan of Cosmic Reaver Kassadin <3 Such sparkle!

I refuse to believe for one second that you guys could possibly have been surprised by Star Guardian Lux's reception when that was one of the most popular community skin ideas for ages before it was finally made.

We were very genuinely surprised at the overwhelming response to it. It was a popular community thematic but at the same time we just didn't know that a bubblegum pink, magical girl themed Lux would be so popular.

Well, to be honest, we've been waiting for a "Fun, Lighthearted" skin for Lux for several years. Because all of Lux's other skins are very "dark" or "Gritty". If you compare the time it took from Steel Legion Lux (her last skin iirc) and Star Guardian Lux, the time, and the fact that it was a DRASTIC departure from Lux's other skins, meant that it was going to be a VERY popular skin.

This.

I was being interviewed at the time and one of the questioned asked by the team was 'What is my least favourite skin?' and my reply was 'Every Lux skin'. Call me cheeky, but I had been thinking about it a lot and was just baffled how far off the mark all her skins had felt (except spellthief but the quality/lore tie-in were never that strong). They laughed and showed me what they were working on - I was really excited! It's funny looking back how I entered the interview with a long list of questions about why certain things hadn't been done in LoL and found the answers were, 9 times out of 10, either a) we tried it and it doesn't work for these reasons, b)  we want to do it but it's not a priority for good reasons or c) we are working on it right now!

Part of that surprise is a measure of cautious optimism. For example when embarking on making a whole Star Guardian patch we also have to be mindful that some of Lux's success could be from that feeling of finally having THE skin for Lux and not so much the specific theme itself. It's interesting then to see how it's received on champions like Lulu who fit the theme but aren't so starved for a skin that serves that space. Same with PROJECT; is it really the hypest of hype or would any sci-fi skin on Yasuo have been super popular? (spoilers it was the former, PROJECT is the hypest of hype)

Wonderful, then the years that the skins team (and the company as a whole) telling us otherwise was a _**complete lie**_.  Really wish I knew the truth before I started putting my money into this company.  Very disappointing to find out this way, I have to admit.

Aren't most/all of your skins popular? Sure, there are some more popular than others, but what's considered the least popular that isn't from the "old" days of LoL?

Sometimes we have high expectations for a skin line because we think it will resonate well and turns out it just didn't quite hit it. Academy is a good example, new thematic, lots of buzz around 'school' themed skins. It turned out to just not be a thematic that everyone was looking for on those champs. The feedback we got on them was great, you just don't see them in-game very often.

the problem with academy skins is that they were just 750 skins, no particle changes, just model changes. and they were for champions   who had previous skins that just felt superior to those.  i think it was just a timing thing.

The problem with the Academy line was that Academy Ekko came out three months after the champ's very hyped and successful release.  It looked like a completely cynical cash grab to capitalize on all the hype and I think enough players saw through it.

Also, every other champ in that line had a hyped skin released less than a year before (Dunkmaster Darius, Blood Lord Vladimir and Challenger Ahri), so it was a case of too many skins too quickly.
